physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Neurologic examination revealed frequent hiccups; decreased short-term recall (1 of 5 words) after 5 minutes with normal registration; a 4â€“6 Hz, low-amplitude postural and action tremor of the right hand; appendicular ataxia of the upper limbs; and gait ataxia, especially prominent with tandem gait. The remainder of the physical examination was normal.
The patient's tremor, cognitive dysfunction, and imbalance had resolved.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: There was improvement as evidenced by the resolution of tremor, cognitive dysfunction, and imbalance at 6-month follow-up.
